newsitem.title: GREECE: Hellenic Technodomiki cleared for rights issue.
newsitem.headline: Hellenic Technodomiki cleared for rights issue.

text.p: Hellenic Technodomiki got shareholder approval at its annual shareholders meeting on Thursday for a 7.7 billion drachma rights issue planned for mid-May.
Rights will entitle shareholders to one new share per one outstanding at 1,400 drachmas. A total of 5.5 million new shares will be issued. The subscription period will run from mid-May to mid-June.
Hellenic Technodomiki will trade ex-rights and ex-dividend on May 9. It will pay a 1996 dividend per share of 200 drachmas from 170 a year earlier.
The construction firm posted 1996 pretax earnings of 3.25 billion drachmas, up 32 percent on 1995. Turnover grew 14 percent to 24.36 billion.
Its orderbook of uncompleted projects exceeds 70 billion drachmas, management said. --George Georgiopoulos, Athens Newsroom +301 3311812-4
